definition: lit. can pass through (an opening)/fig. can get by (in life)/tolerably well/not too bad/How are you getting by?/How's life?
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: I'm able to get by, but it could be better.
sentences.chinese: 我的餬口還過得去，不過還可以更好。

sentences.english: Don't bother to move I think I can just brush past.
sentences.chinese: 用不着讓開，我想我剛好能過得去。

sentences.english: I'd say her work is of a reasonable standard.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲她的工作水平還過得去。

sentences.english: Well, maybe you can go without it for awhile, until you do find a used version.
sentences.chinese: 也許，在找到一個二手的之前，一時沒有它也過得去。

sentences.english: B: I'm able to get by, but it could be better.
sentences.chinese: 我的生活還過得去，不過還可以更好。

sentences.english: Does the new manager pass muster?
His pronunciation, if not good, is at least tolerable.
sentences.chinese: 他的發音如果說不算好，至少也還過得去。

sentences.english: Your work will get by,but try to improve it.
sentences.chinese: 你的作業還過得去，但要努力改進。
